source.title: Xanthorrhoeaceae

source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J. (1994). Xanthorrhoeaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves 2–4 mm wide; male inflorescence unbranched or with short appressed branches, less than 3 cm wide and 15 cm long; bracts often barely exceeding flower clusters; scape often purplish
Leaves 4–10 mm wide; male inflorescence generally branched, more than 3 cm wide and 15 cm long, bracts usually very prominent; scape usually pale, yellowish or green
